attributes.action: More council, police and youth support to address vandalism in Kidbrooke
attributes.additional_details:
Bikes and mobility scooters have been dumped in the park pond.

Weapons have been found, and people have been robbed in broad daylight, raising serious concerns.

There have been reports of sexually inappropriate behaviour in the park, making it very unsafe for families.

Many young people have nowhere to go after school, increasing the risk of them getting involved in anti-social behaviour.

The community cares but needs real support to make Kidbrooke safer and more positive for everyone.
attributes.background:
Increase police presence and action in parks and public spaces, especially during after-school hours.

Provide more funding and support to the local council to offer affordable, accessible after-school activities.

Invest in community initiatives and events to help bring residents together.

rejection.details:
We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level. 

  

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this. 

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP 

And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/ 

If you think a crime has been committed, you should contact the police: https://www.police.uk/pu/contact-us/
